title: How to Draw a Rhino

steps.headline: Start off with the head.
steps.description: Draw these shapes that would guide you in drawing. Draw a circle, a curved oval and a curvy triangle as shown, add in guidelines.

steps.headline: Sketch in the ears, small eyes, nostrils and two horns or one depending on what species, a large and a small one.
Form the body.
steps.description: Draw an oval for the neck and two more large ones for the front and back part of the body.

steps.headline: Add in four sets of two large ovals for each leg and don't forget to add in hooves.
Outline your rhino and if you want you could add in layers of skin as shown, for the armor-like effect; erase guidelines.
Color your rhino with a hint of gray or brown (or whatever color you want), and you're done!
steps.description: Add in some birds hitching a ride at the back of the rhino if you want.

text: Start off with the head. Draw these shapes that would guide you in drawing. Draw a circle, a curved oval and a curvy triangle as shown, add in guidelines. Sketch in the ears, small eyes, nostrils and two horns or one depending on what species, a large and a small one.  Form the body. Draw an oval for the neck and two more large ones for the front and back part of the body. Add in four sets of two large ovals for each leg and don't forget to add in hooves. Add in a small tail. Outline your rhino and if you want you could add in layers of skin as shown, for the armor-like effect; erase guidelines.  Color your rhino with a hint of gray or brown (or whatever color you want), and you're done! Add in some birds hitching a ride at the back of the rhino if you want.
